item.title: Teeth Mark
item.description: Spare, beautiful folk music.
item.content:encoded: Spare, beautiful folk music.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: From Capelton Hill
item.description: This is very much an album about what it means to have spent twenty years making music that is almost entirely about being in your late twenties and feeling that the most important parts of life are happening and fleeting. It is soft and comforting and you can't help but feel that, outside of the impressiveness that you're listening to it at all (I remember seeing Stars in DC in, what, 2010, and being blown away!) it feels a bit hollow, a bit like a cove
item.content:encoded: This is very much an album about what it means to have spent twenty years making music that is almost entirely about being in your late twenties and feeling that the most important parts of life are happening and fleeting. It is soft and comforting and you can't help but feel that, outside of the impressiveness that you're listening to it at all (I remember seeing Stars in DC in, what, 2010, and being blown away!) it feels a bit hollow, a bit like a cove
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: WE
item.description: The Lightning II is an absolute banger but this feels a bit like a cover band (or, a more modern version: a DALL-E rendition of an Arcade Fire album).
item.content:encoded: The Lightning II is an absolute banger but this feels a bit like a cover band (or, a more modern version: a DALL-E rendition of an Arcade Fire album).
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Waltz for Debby
item.description: This, to me, is what jazz is, perfect and timeless.
item.content:encoded: This, to me, is what jazz is, perfect and timeless.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Butterfly Blue
item.description: My only memory of Mallrat was listening to For Real a few hundred times back in 2016, so this album was not really what I expected — wavier and dreamier. One terrible Azealia Banks verse aside, I liked it quite a bit: relaxing, sweet, and dreamlike without being gratuitous.
item.content:encoded: My only memory of Mallrat was listening to For Real a few hundred times back in 2016, so this album was not really what I expected — wavier and dreamier. One terrible Azealia Banks verse aside, I liked it quite a bit: relaxing, sweet, and dreamlike without being gratuitous.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: So Far So Good
item.description: Shocked to discover that Pitchfork liked a pop EDM record more than I did. This wasn’t bad, but there are just way more entertaining takes on the pop crossover record than this.
item.content:encoded: Shocked to discover that Pitchfork liked a pop EDM record more than I did. This wasn’t bad, but there are just way more entertaining takes on the pop crossover record than this.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Come Home The Kids Miss You
item.description: I think the Pitchfork review was a little harsh and felt somehow like punching down, but...yeah, the album's not good. The production is fine but milquetoast and some of the punchline raps are the worst bars I've heard in years. There are no moments of exult.
item.content:encoded: I think the Pitchfork review was a little harsh and felt somehow like punching down, but...yeah, the album's not good. The production is fine but milquetoast and some of the punchline raps are the worst bars I've heard in years. There are no moments of exult.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Un Verano Sin Ti
item.description: Some fun beats but the thing felt discohesive and overlong to me. (AKA: it failed the "can I tell that the album is over and it shifted to random songs" test.)
item.content:encoded: Some fun beats but the thing felt discohesive and overlong to me. (AKA: it failed the "can I tell that the album is over and it shifted to random songs" test.)
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Dance Fever
item.description: I'll be honest — I forgot how fun Florence + The Machine is.
item.content:encoded: I'll be honest — I forgot how fun Florence + The Machine is.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Mr. Morale and the Big Steppers
item.description: My "Sing About Me / Dying Of Thirst is the greatest passage of hip-hop in the 21st century" take is potentially being updated to "Auntie Diaries / Mr. Morale / Mother I Sober is the greatest passage of hip-hop in the 21st century".
item.content:encoded: My "Sing About Me / Dying Of Thirst is the greatest passage of hip-hop in the 21st century" take is potentially being updated to "Auntie Diaries / Mr. Morale / Mother I Sober is the greatest passage of hip-hop in the 21st century".
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Multitude
item.description: He continues to have the bops!
item.content:encoded: He continues to have the bops!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: It's Almost Dry
item.description: "Like Brady, gets better with time / Didn’t have to reinvent the wheel, just a better design" sums up this album. It lacks the heater-heater brutality of [[Daytona]], but it just so damn good and fun even if it is not genre-defining (or even Pusha T-defining). And that Kanye track is the first good Kanye-related thing in my eyes in like...three
item.content:encoded: "Like Brady, gets better with time / Didn’t have to reinvent the wheel, just a better design" sums up this album. It lacks the heater-heater brutality of [[Daytona]], but it just so damn good and fun even if it is not genre-defining (or even Pusha T-defining). And that Kanye track is the first good Kanye-related thing in my eyes in like...three
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Humble Quest
item.description: Pitchfork describes this album as "matter-of-factly masterful", and I think that's apt! This is need something that breaks out of its country-pop confines, but it's a very pleasant and mellifluous country-pop album that feels good for warm Sunday afternoons. It is sweet and well-produced and I smiled listening to it.
item.content:encoded: Pitchfork describes this album as "matter-of-factly masterful", and I think that's apt! This is need something that breaks out of its country-pop confines, but it's a very pleasant and mellifluous country-pop album that feels good for warm Sunday afternoons. It is sweet and well-produced and I smiled listening to it.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Dragon New Warm Mountain I Believe In You
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: DFTK
item.description: I didn't love everything in the album, but the opener is a banger and it feels sonically much more interesting than the median Young Thug-lineage album. There isn't the level of...malaise that I associate with a lot of these drops.
item.content:encoded: I didn't love everything in the album, but the opener is a banger and it feels sonically much more interesting than the median Young Thug-lineage album. There isn't the level of...malaise that I associate with a lot of these drops.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Crest
item.description: Nothing wrong with it, but simply...boring tonally, unexperimental, not doing anything for me at all.
item.content:encoded: Nothing wrong with it, but simply...boring tonally, unexperimental, not doing anything for me at all.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Portrait in Jazz
item.description: Utterly delightful and maasterful.
item.content:encoded: Utterly delightful and maasterful.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Glitch Princess
item.description: Weird without being precious and esoteric without being unpleasant. This feels like an order of magnitude stranger (and in a good way!) than the XCX experimental stuff. L
item.content:encoded: Weird without being precious and esoteric without being unpleasant. This feels like an order of magnitude stranger (and in a good way!) than the XCX experimental stuff. L
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Lilac
item.description: Fun and light and probably my favorite pop maximalist album that I've listened to this year.
item.content:encoded: Fun and light and probably my favorite pop maximalist album that I've listened to this year.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Tana Talk 4
item.description: Nothing wrong with it, but incredibly underwhelming.
item.content:encoded: Nothing wrong with it, but incredibly underwhelming.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Things Are Great
item.description: Sure is a Band of Horses album! Sure does remind me of commuting to a shitty internship in 2011! Sure kinda feels more like a facsimile than something new, but at least it's warm.
item.content:encoded: Sure is a Band of Horses album! Sure does remind me of commuting to a shitty internship in 2011! Sure kinda feels more like a facsimile than something new, but at least it's warm.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Fantasy
item.description: Rainy, ethereal breakbeats & post-rave. I wish this was twice or thrice as long; as soon as I feel like I'm getting into it the album is over.
item.content:encoded: Rainy, ethereal breakbeats & post-rave. I wish this was twice or thrice as long; as soon as I feel like I'm getting into it the album is over.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Valdevaqueros
item.description: Very solid "night-time pop", and perhaps the sole thing of redeeming artistic merit of [[Emily in Paris]], as I was alerted to its presence by the show's use of it as a closing track.
item.content:encoded: Very solid "night-time pop", and perhaps the sole thing of redeeming artistic merit of [[Emily in Paris]], as I was alerted to its presence by the show's use of it as a closing track.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Sick!
item.description: The first album of the year that just did absolutely nothing for me.
item.content:encoded: The first album of the year that just did absolutely nothing for me.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Piano Ten Thousand Leaves - 5th Selection
item.description: Beautiful and sparse piano instrumentation. Very good for cold mornings with coffee & a crossword or focusing on writing.
item.content:encoded: Beautiful and sparse piano instrumentation. Very good for cold mornings with coffee & a crossword or focusing on writing.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Magic
item.description: I have absolutely no qualms with this album. The rhymes are great, the production is classic (if a bit overly nostalgic), and it doesn't outstay its welcome.
item.content:encoded: I have absolutely no qualms with this album. The rhymes are great, the production is classic (if a bit overly nostalgic), and it doesn't outstay its welcome.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Fragments
item.description: Reminds me a lot of, well, other Bonobo albums, but also Thrupence. I'll be giving it a couple more listens as it is perfectly reasonable and nice coding music, even if it has not changed my understanding of what Bonobo's ambitions are.
item.content:encoded: Reminds me a lot of, well, other Bonobo albums, but also Thrupence. I'll be giving it a couple more listens as it is perfectly reasonable and nice coding music, even if it has not changed my understanding of what Bonobo's ambitions are.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Dawn FM
item.description: You know, the concept is really cool, and I think I might try a couple more times to see if it grows on me, but I simply could not give a shit about the production.
item.content:encoded: You know, the concept is really cool, and I think I might try a couple more times to see if it grows on me, but I simply could not give a shit about the production.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: The Makin' Magick II Album
item.description: Okay, now we're talking. Less moody than [[The Other World]] and captures the same surreal verve as [[Charmed]]. Definitely will be revisiting many many times this year, even if it feels its length a little more than the latter.
item.content:encoded: Okay, now we're talking. Less moody than [[The Other World]] and captures the same surreal verve as [[Charmed]]. Definitely will be revisiting many many times this year, even if it feels its length a little more than the latter.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: The Other Realm
item.description: Lacks a bit of the pure verve of [[Charmed]], which is a fundamental album to me, but still boppy & an easy way to lose yourself for a
item.content:encoded: Lacks a bit of the pure verve of [[Charmed]], which is a fundamental album to me, but still boppy & an easy way to lose yourself for a
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Fiat Lux
item.description: More academic than listenable, but undeniably beautiful.
item.content:encoded: More academic than listenable, but undeniably beautiful.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Big Sleepover
item.description: A couple fun productions (Can't Sleep's hook is incredible!) but the verses feel a little dialed-in and I'm at the point of time where I am not particularly blown away by bedroom rap.
item.content:encoded: A couple fun productions (Can't Sleep's hook is incredible!) but the verses feel a little dialed-in and I'm at the point of time where I am not particularly blown away by bedroom rap.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Live!
item.description: This is so much fun, and the fact that my fiance called it "muzak" is honestly grounds for divorce.
item.content:encoded: This is so much fun, and the fact that my fiance called it "muzak" is honestly grounds for divorce.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: The Brightness
item.description: This is a nice album, and it is fun to listen to Anais suss out some of her work and get a glimpse into her maturation (Hades & Persephone made it all the way to Hadestown!) but the songwriting here is just weaker than Young Man In America, a perfect gem of a folk record. This feels sparser, muter, and less interesting, though still nice.
item.content:encoded: This is a nice album, and it is fun to listen to Anais suss out some of her work and get a glimpse into her maturation (Hades & Persephone made it all the way to Hadestown!) but the songwriting here is just weaker than Young Man In America, a perfect gem of a folk record. This feels sparser, muter, and less interesting, though still nice.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: It's All Smiles
item.description: The production is too glitchy & clever to be pleasant or interesting, which in of itself is not a huge deal except that the lyrics & vocals are so featherweight that it's not worth the effort of digestion.
item.content:encoded: The production is too glitchy & clever to be pleasant or interesting, which in of itself is not a huge deal except that the lyrics & vocals are so featherweight that it's not worth the effort of digestion.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Balsams
item.description: I don't think I was quite in the right headspace to listen to this, which was airy and minute without hinting at any sort of deeper beauty. Will probably try to give it another go!
item.content:encoded: I don't think I was quite in the right headspace to listen to this, which was airy and minute without hinting at any sort of deeper beauty. Will probably try to give it another go!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Hadestown (2021)
item.description: It's not a masterpiece like the 2010 original, but — separated from its musical trappings — feels like something of a well-executed live action reboot. There are moments of repetition and subtext turned into text and those things aren't great, but it feels good to spend more time in this world, and to drink a bit more of it than usual. (And the execution is tremendous, too, even if I miss Anais and Justin's original vocals.)
item.content:encoded: It's not a masterpiece like the 2010 original, but — separated from its musical trappings — feels like something of a well-executed live action reboot. There are moments of repetition and subtext turned into text and those things aren't great, but it feels good to spend more time in this world, and to drink a bit more of it than usual. (And the execution is tremendous, too, even if I miss Anais and Justin's original vocals.)
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: MP Da Last Don
item.description: 106 is too many minutes for almost any album, let alone one as rambling & repetitive as this. There's a lot of nice moments, and at its height it feels like an all-night party (a cliche, I know, but the bevy of fun features and energy changes makes it a hard one to resist).
item.content:encoded: 106 is too many minutes for almost any album, let alone one as rambling & repetitive as this. There's a lot of nice moments, and at its height it feels like an all-night party (a cliche, I know, but the bevy of fun features and energy changes makes it a hard one to resist).
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.description: Adele has such a good voice!
item.content:encoded: Adele has such a good voice!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Salt
item.description: Relatively upbeat and fun, but a little too — what's the word? Estoeric? Weird? — for me.
item.content:encoded: Relatively upbeat and fun, but a little too — what's the word? Estoeric? Weird? — for me.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Red (Taylor's Version)
item.description: Nothing wrong with this, but it is interminably long and I do not think it is interesting enough to justify two fucking hours of runtime, except perhaps to superfans.
item.content:encoded: Nothing wrong with this, but it is interminably long and I do not think it is interesting enough to justify two fucking hours of runtime, except perhaps to superfans.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: An Evening With Silk Sonic
item.description: Yes, it's 70's cosplay, and it's a little sterile, but who cares? It's fun!
item.content:encoded: Yes, it's 70's cosplay, and it's a little sterile, but who cares? It's fun!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Voyage
item.description: Nothing wrong with this album, but it just makes me feel old as shit.
item.content:encoded: Nothing wrong with this album, but it just makes me feel old as shit.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Makin' Magick
item.description: It just doesn't hit the exultant highs of Charmed, and I just can't really see myself listening to this over again due to the length compared to Charmed.
item.content:encoded: It just doesn't hit the exultant highs of Charmed, and I just can't really see myself listening to this over again due to the length compared to Charmed.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: How Long Do You Think It's Gonna Last?
item.description: Mostly a reminder that Anais Mitchell is perfect and I need to listen to her more often. Less glibly, I thought this was as good-not-great as a side project gets: it suffers from lack of gestalt (as evinced by the lackluster second half) but the songs are pleasant and good even if they don't quite cohere.
item.content:encoded: Mostly a reminder that Anais Mitchell is perfect and I need to listen to her more often. Less glibly, I thought this was as good-not-great as a side project gets: it suffers from lack of gestalt (as evinced by the lackluster second half) but the songs are pleasant and good even if they don't quite cohere.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Screen Violence
item.description: This is the worst Chvrches album, and it’s still compulsively listenable — but besides the commitment to a bit of a horror-movie aesthetic it doesn’t have any of the moments of sheer glee or revelation that every previous entry does, and the lyrics are at a nadir.
item.content:encoded: This is the worst Chvrches album, and it’s still compulsively listenable — but besides the commitment to a bit of a horror-movie aesthetic it doesn’t have any of the moments of sheer glee or revelation that every previous entry does, and the lyrics are at a nadir.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Shade
item.description: This is 'experimental' and not in a way that I find fun or rewarding.
item.content:encoded: This is 'experimental' and not in a way that I find fun or rewarding.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Cheese
item.description: It is firmly worse than anything that came after it, but still kind of catchy!
item.content:encoded: It is firmly worse than anything that came after it, but still kind of catchy!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Floating Mountains
item.description: This failed the "can you tell when this album ends and Spotify transitions to Discover Weekly?" test three times in a row.
item.content:encoded: This failed the "can you tell when this album ends and Spotify transitions to Discover Weekly?" test three times in a row.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Summer is Over
item.description: God help me — this is not good music, it is uninteresting, but I love it so much. It is tailor-made for me.
item.content:encoded: God help me — this is not good music, it is uninteresting, but I love it so much. It is tailor-made for me.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Talk Memory
item.description: Feels a little too atonal & uninteresting for my tastes.
item.content:encoded: Feels a little too atonal & uninteresting for my tastes.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Sometime I Might Be Introvert
item.description: Opening track might be my favorite single track of the year, but the album is a bit too interlude-heavy and all over the place for me. Probably worth relistening to
item.content:encoded: Opening track might be my favorite single track of the year, but the album is a bit too interlude-heavy and all over the place for me. Probably worth relistening to
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Star-Crossed
item.description: The obvious and deserved comparison is with Evermore/Folklore — a stripped down, mellower version of the author's ouevre. While I think Taylor's latest outings are good-not-great, I thought this was closer to great; the songwriting is steadier and more interesting, and the pathos hits a little stronger.
item.content:encoded: The obvious and deserved comparison is with Evermore/Folklore — a stripped down, mellower version of the author's ouevre. While I think Taylor's latest outings are good-not-great, I thought this was closer to great; the songwriting is steadier and more interesting, and the pathos hits a little stronger.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Our Bande Apart
item.description: This is the first time in my life I have thought about Third Eye Blind in a way that isn't just "Semi-Charmed Life" and..this album is pretty sonically fun? "The Dying Blood" will be stuck in my head for a while. It is not a revolutionary album, but it was short and sweet.
item.content:encoded: This is the first time in my life I have thought about Third Eye Blind in a way that isn't just "Semi-Charmed Life" and..this album is pretty sonically fun? "The Dying Blood" will be stuck in my head for a while. It is not a revolutionary album, but it was short and sweet.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Fingers Crossed
item.description: This is exactly the genre of music I have spent a long time being obsessed with, and I am almost wistful that I am finally listening to this album now that I've put most of my twee obsessions behind me.
item.content:encoded: This is exactly the genre of music I have spent a long time being obsessed with, and I am almost wistful that I am finally listening to this album now that I've put most of my twee obsessions behind me.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Moment Bends
item.description: Pleasant and defanged.
item.content:encoded: Pleasant and defanged.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Nastavi, Calliope
item.description: Too much angst, not enough sonic.
item.content:encoded: Too much angst, not enough sonic.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Space 1.8
item.description: Quiet and unassuming but pleasant enough to want to listen to a second time
item.content:encoded: Quiet and unassuming but pleasant enough to want to listen to a second time
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: The Day I Saw The Rainbow
item.description: Beautiful.
item.content:encoded: Beautiful.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Demon Days
item.description: I'll be honest... I don't get it? I liked the DOOM verse! It didn't sound bad! But it was not particularly fun or interesting.
item.content:encoded: I'll be honest... I don't get it? I liked the DOOM verse! It didn't sound bad! But it was not particularly fun or interesting.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Baduizm
item.description: Very relaxing and pleasant and simple and great. Nothing revelatory but I see myself coming back to this over and over (and finally understand the Badu hype.)
item.content:encoded: Very relaxing and pleasant and simple and great. Nothing revelatory but I see myself coming back to this over and over (and finally understand the Badu hype.)
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Bayani
item.description: Yes, it's clearly a record of its time — 2007 backpack rap through and through. But it's fun! And it's good! I am a sucker for all of the Seattle references, obviously, but the production is great and while the vocals are not exactly revelatory, the writing is solid (if not, again, an artifact of what it meant to be an alt-rapper in 2007). The thing holds up well.
item.content:encoded: Yes, it's clearly a record of its time — 2007 backpack rap through and through. But it's fun! And it's good! I am a sucker for all of the Seattle references, obviously, but the production is great and while the vocals are not exactly revelatory, the writing is solid (if not, again, an artifact of what it meant to be an alt-rapper in 2007). The thing holds up well.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: DONDA
item.description: I found it more consumable and interesting than anything post-Yeezus, but does it have to be so fucking long?
item.content:encoded: I found it more consumable and interesting than anything post-Yeezus, but does it have to be so fucking long?
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Solar Power
item.description: Hard to resist the Folklore / Evermore comparisons, and both of those album — while milquetoast — at least to invite enjoyable listening. This felt like it was an album filled with tracks that were meant to be played in late-era episodes of Felicity.
item.content:encoded: Hard to resist the Folklore / Evermore comparisons, and both of those album — while milquetoast — at least to invite enjoyable listening. This felt like it was an album filled with tracks that were meant to be played in late-era episodes of Felicity.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Anjelitu
item.description: Funky feels like an apt word to use for a short, fun, weird EP that ends with a great Aesop Rock collab.
item.content:encoded: Funky feels like an apt word to use for a short, fun, weird EP that ends with a great Aesop Rock collab.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: leon mode
item.description: A bit too glitch-y for my tastes, but it's fun! Not gonna beat the VGM sunshine of his previous work.
item.content:encoded: A bit too glitch-y for my tastes, but it's fun! Not gonna beat the VGM sunshine of his previous work.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: The Album
item.description: I would forgive the simplicity of the bubblegum or the datedness of the production or the very short runtime if any of these songs were bops but...they weren't? It just wasn't a very fu album.
item.content:encoded: I would forgive the simplicity of the bubblegum or the datedness of the production or the very short runtime if any of these songs were bops but...they weren't? It just wasn't a very fu album.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Take the Sadness Out of Saturday Night
item.description: I don't mean this in a bad way, but boy is this a Bleachers album. I mean, maybe a little bit of a bad way.
item.content:encoded: I don't mean this in a bad way, but boy is this a Bleachers album. I mean, maybe a little bit of a bad way.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: moment l.p.
item.description: Nice J-Pop, even though I was hoping for something more DJ Okawari-esque given that I discovered them via the Nujabes collab!
item.content:encoded: Nice J-Pop, even though I was hoping for something more DJ Okawari-esque given that I discovered them via the Nujabes collab!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Bae
item.description: Just...straight up less boppy and interesting than Bae 5 (which I listened to yesterday). Good for Yung Bae as growing and improving as an artist!
item.content:encoded: Just...straight up less boppy and interesting than Bae 5 (which I listened to yesterday). Good for Yung Bae as growing and improving as an artist!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Bae 5
item.description: It's fun!
item.content:encoded: It's fun!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Sob Rock
item.description: Alexa, play "mi
item.content:encoded: Alexa, play "mi
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Yasuragi Land
item.description: No! I hate it! This is weird! No!
item.content:encoded: No! I hate it! This is weird! No!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Space Jam: A New Legacy: Soundtrack
item.description: I mean, it certainly wasn't good, and some of the Looney Tunes references were truly awful, but I didn't hate listening to it!
item.content:encoded: I mean, it certainly wasn't good, and some of the Looney Tunes references were truly awful, but I didn't hate listening to it!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Riot!
item.description: This album slaps, and it's very fun to imagine a world in which I got obsessed with this singularly rather than From Under The Cork Tree. How different the last fifteen years might have been!
item.content:encoded: This album slaps, and it's very fun to imagine a world in which I got obsessed with this singularly rather than From Under The Cork Tree. How different the last fifteen years might have been!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: The Life of Pi’erre 4
item.description: Same-y, boppy hiphop. Not consequential or memorable (besides the production tag) but fun!
item.content:encoded: Same-y, boppy hiphop. Not consequential or memorable (besides the production tag) but fun!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Blue
item.description: Seems like a nice album! Sounded great! Just didn't care! (I know, this makes me a bad person.)
item.content:encoded: Seems like a nice album! Sounded great! Just didn't care! (I know, this makes me a bad person.)
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: epiphany
item.description: I gotta stop taking album advice from Pitchfork. This was fine but why am I listening to this?
item.content:encoded: I gotta stop taking album advice from Pitchfork. This was fine but why am I listening to this?
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Jubilee
item.description: This was a pleasant album to listen to that had absolutely no lasting effect whatsoever.
item.content:encoded: This was a pleasant album to listen to that had absolutely no lasting effect whatsoever.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Changephobia
item.description: Felt...forgettable? I need to spend some more time with it.
item.content:encoded: Felt...forgettable? I need to spend some more time with it.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Off the Yak
item.description: Pitchfork described this artist as being one of the best to come out of a theoretical "rap battle" and boy did that set some wrong expectations for this very uneven album.
item.content:encoded: Pitchfork described this artist as being one of the best to come out of a theoretical "rap battle" and boy did that set some wrong expectations for this very uneven album.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: SOUR
item.description: Hard not to resist the girl in red comparison and boy was that album more interesting, more fun, and more pleasant than this one!
item.content:encoded: Hard not to resist the girl in red comparison and boy was that album more interesting, more fun, and more pleasant than this one!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: The Off-Season
item.description: Some legitimately great lines and production and also some of the corniest lines I have heard in years and it's hard to disentangle the two.
item.content:encoded: Some legitimately great lines and production and also some of the corniest lines I have heard in years and it's hard to disentangle the two.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Music for Living Spaces
item.description: Music for Airports for the 21st century. Perfect music, gentle and lilting and quiet.
item.content:encoded: Music for Airports for the 21st century. Perfect music, gentle and lilting and quiet.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Yasuke
item.description: Incredible beats. What's not to love?
item.content:encoded: Incredible beats. What's not to love?
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: if I could make it go quiet
item.description: Very-good-bordering-on-great pop-punk bordering on the style of Charly Bliss. A little uneven but the highs are very high, and I see myself listening to this over and over again.
item.content:encoded: Very-good-bordering-on-great pop-punk bordering on the style of Charly Bliss. A little uneven but the highs are very high, and I see myself listening to this over and over again.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: The Fellowship
item.description: I am a sucker for all things Joseph Shabason at this point, and maybe it's fair to call this album a little too reminiscent of his prior work, but — who cares? It's sonically diverse and lush and delightful to listen to.
item.content:encoded: I am a sucker for all things Joseph Shabason at this point, and maybe it's fair to call this album a little too reminiscent of his prior work, but — who cares? It's sonically diverse and lush and delightful to listen to.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Deltron 3030
item.description: I feel bad not liking this album that much...? The first two tracks are iconic and the production is so fun but man it is just not that interesting to listen
item.content:encoded: I feel bad not liking this album that much...? The first two tracks are iconic and the production is so fun but man it is just not that interesting to listen
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: C-GIRL
item.description: The vocals were a bit too aggressive but overall the same pleasant, unmemorable-but-solid pop vibes that the rest of her albums entail. It's not live changing, but it is good!
item.content:encoded: The vocals were a bit too aggressive but overall the same pleasant, unmemorable-but-solid pop vibes that the rest of her albums entail. It's not live changing, but it is good!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Islah
item.description: One of my favorite albums in a while, and definitely one of my favorite tracks in a long while (Two Phones). I am not at all embarrassed to say my introduction to this album is via Frasier.
item.content:encoded: One of my favorite albums in a while, and definitely one of my favorite tracks in a long while (Two Phones). I am not at all embarrassed to say my introduction to this album is via Frasier.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Nurture
item.description: I liked the singles more than the gestalt and I had already listened to all of the singles already :(
item.content:encoded: I liked the singles more than the gestalt and I had already listened to all of the singles already :(
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: FEVER DREAM
item.description: Wow they got generic quick!
item.content:encoded: Wow they got generic quick!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Haram
item.description: Features aside, I just wasn't super engaged. Might try another few listens to see if it sticks.
item.content:encoded: Features aside, I just wasn't super engaged. Might try another few listens to see if it sticks.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Fiesta & Fiascos
item.description: I am not enough of a Craig Finn diehard to have enjoyed listen
item.content:encoded: I am not enough of a Craig Finn diehard to have enjoyed listen
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: To See The Next Part Of The Dream
item.description: This is the kind of album that you respect rather than you like.
item.content:encoded: This is the kind of album that you respect rather than you like.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Before the Dawn Heals Us
item.description: I think I would have loved this album a lot more if I was 1) in high school (not a knock against the album!) 2) ignorant of all the other M83 albums that have succeeded it.
item.content:encoded: I think I would have loved this album a lot more if I was 1) in high school (not a knock against the album!) 2) ignorant of all the other M83 albums that have succeeded it.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Omoiyari
item.description: Inconsequential and pleasant!
item.content:encoded: Inconsequential and pleasant!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Muldrew
item.description: This just doesn't do it for me! Too weird! Too atypical! I wanted nice glitchy jazz!
item.content:encoded: This just doesn't do it for me! Too weird! Too atypical! I wanted nice glitchy jazz!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Glass
item.description: 5 Wagon is an absolute banger, and the production is fun, but the back half feels a little lyrically vacuous.
item.content:encoded: 5 Wagon is an absolute banger, and the production is fun, but the back half feels a little lyrically vacuous.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Harlecore
item.description: This is too much for me!
item.content:encoded: This is too much for me!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: All These Perfect Crosses
item.description: I just don't really care about B-Sides albums. This is fine! The horns version of God in Chicago is great! But I don't care!
item.content:encoded: I just don't really care about B-Sides albums. This is fine! The horns version of God in Chicago is great! But I don't care!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Tidvatten
item.description: Very downbeat and forgettable house music. (Calling it House might be incorrect; it's ideologically and aesthetically more similar to something like Tycho.)
item.content:encoded: Very downbeat and forgettable house music. (Calling it House might be incorrect; it's ideologically and aesthetically more similar to something like Tycho.)
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Juvenile
item.description: Just incredibly buttery, fun, exciting EDM. I love it!
item.content:encoded: Just incredibly buttery, fun, exciting EDM. I love it!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Open Door Policy
item.description: That sure was a Hold Steady album! I don’t know; it doesn’t have the unpolished verve of early THS and it feels like what the band is trying to do now is more steadily and laudibly accomplished by Craig’s solo work. It’s not bad, but — why listen to this album?
item.content:encoded: That sure was a Hold Steady album! I don’t know; it doesn’t have the unpolished verve of early THS and it feels like what the band is trying to do now is more steadily and laudibly accomplished by Craig’s solo work. It’s not bad, but — why listen to this album?
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Life After Death
item.description: It is an overstuffed record and there is a bit too much going on but man, he is just so so so good and there are too many classic tracks.
item.content:encoded: It is an overstuffed record and there is a bit too much going on but man, he is just so so so good and there are too many classic tracks.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Charmed
item.description: Leisurely, delightful, warm house music. Comically long run-time, but it's so familiar and yet expansive that I find myself listening to it over and over again.
item.content:encoded: Leisurely, delightful, warm house music. Comically long run-time, but it's so familiar and yet expansive that I find myself listening to it over and over again.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: A N M L 7
item.description: Lo-fi sadboy forgettable hiphop.
item.content:encoded: Lo-fi sadboy forgettable hiphop.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: [USA]
item.description: There were some nice, chiptuney bops. I probably should have paid more attention, but it didn't seem to demand it of me!
item.content:encoded: There were some nice, chiptuney bops. I probably should have paid more attention, but it didn't seem to demand it of me!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: HANADRIEL
item.description: Way too scattershot to legitimately enjoy.
item.content:encoded: Way too scattershot to legitimately enjoy.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: The Finish Line
item.description: Above average rote chill hop.
item.content:encoded: Above average rote chill hop.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Pop Music / False B-Sides II
item.description: Every single Baths album has one line that absolutely murders me and apparently this one decided it should be Is it love / or is it focus?
item.content:encoded: Every single Baths album has one line that absolutely murders me and apparently this one decided it should be Is it love / or is it focus?
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: The Aces
item.description: Some isolated bops but extremely uneven and unfinished in terms of feel.
item.content:encoded: Some isolated bops but extremely uneven and unfinished in terms of feel.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: All The Good Times
item.description: This is not my genre of music! But it was sweet and loamy and wistful in a way that I can appreciate, even if it's not a bottle I see myself reaching for often.
item.content:encoded: This is not my genre of music! But it was sweet and loamy and wistful in a way that I can appreciate, even if it's not a bottle I see myself reaching for often.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Collapsed in Sunbeams
item.description: Gen Z Corinne Bailey Rae, which is not to say that it sounds bad but it is (to steal a great phrase from the Pitchfork review) a pleasant monotone. I will probably listen to it three more times and forget about it!
item.content:encoded: Gen Z Corinne Bailey Rae, which is not to say that it sounds bad but it is (to steal a great phrase from the Pitchfork review) a pleasant monotone. I will probably listen to it three more times and forget about it!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Burden of Proof
item.description: Honestly, get rid of a couple of the features and this would be an all-timer for me. I loved the verses and production.
item.content:encoded: Honestly, get rid of a couple of the features and this would be an all-timer for me. I loved the verses and production.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Post-Nothing
item.description: I feel embarrassed to say I like Japandroid's later, more polished efforts, but its still solid and growly garage music that errs right on the side of listenability.
item.content:encoded: I feel embarrassed to say I like Japandroid's later, more polished efforts, but its still solid and growly garage music that errs right on the side of listenability.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: .wav
item.description: I remember listening to a couple Flux Pavilion remixes on Hype Machine and Spotify recommended me this album so I thought I would give it a shot. It is one of the most aggressively bad albums I have listened to in a while. I don't understand how you manage to be simultaneously boring and painful.
item.content:encoded: I remember listening to a couple Flux Pavilion remixes on Hype Machine and Spotify recommended me this album so I thought I would give it a shot. It is one of the most aggressively bad albums I have listened to in a while. I don't understand how you manage to be simultaneously boring and painful.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Isles
item.description: Immemorable but fun (and occassionally trippy) dancehall beats. Good coding music!
item.content:encoded: Immemorable but fun (and occassionally trippy) dancehall beats. Good coding music!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: A Million Miles Away
item.description: Lots of incredible bops (the opening six tracks are all fire emoji) with little cohesion and no sense of "oh, this album is over".
item.content:encoded: Lots of incredible bops (the opening six tracks are all fire emoji) with little cohesion and no sense of "oh, this album is over".
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Demidevil
item.description: I didn't hate this (there are Charli XCX-esque peaks in here somewhere) but it feels like a bizarre and intentionally bad mixtape than something to actually 'enjoy' listening to. (Daisy is very fun as a track though!)
item.content:encoded: I didn't hate this (there are Charli XCX-esque peaks in here somewhere) but it feels like a bizarre and intentionally bad mixtape than something to actually 'enjoy' listening to. (Daisy is very fun as a track though!)
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Waken
item.description: Dreamy and ethereal and just a whole bunch of good vibes. Not super memorable, but impactful (and good lord the opening track is so good.)
item.content:encoded: Dreamy and ethereal and just a whole bunch of good vibes. Not super memorable, but impactful (and good lord the opening track is so good.)
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: OK Bamboo
item.description: Pleasant, elegant, and utterly forgettable piano-driven lo-fi. (Discover Tokyo is an incredible track, though.)
item.content:encoded: Pleasant, elegant, and utterly forgettable piano-driven lo-fi. (Discover Tokyo is an incredible track, though.)
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: AINOU
item.description: Pleasant, sunny, genre-bending Japanese indie pop. Not a lot of cohesion but delightful to listen to throughout.
item.content:encoded: Pleasant, sunny, genre-bending Japanese indie pop. Not a lot of cohesion but delightful to listen to throughout.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Savage Mode II
item.description: Some truly awful lyrics but the production and flow is just incredible. Such a fun listen.
item.content:encoded: Some truly awful lyrics but the production and flow is just incredible. Such a fun listen.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Limbo
item.description: I think I might just be a little spoiled because a couple fun puns and sunny production is no longer sufficient to get me into an album.
item.content:encoded: I think I might just be a little spoiled because a couple fun puns and sunny production is no longer sufficient to get me into an album.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: How To Be Human
item.description: Chelsea Cutler belongs to what in my mind is a vanguard of interchangable, pleasant-but-never-transcendent soundcloud pop singers (EXES of course is my favorite in this group). This album is almost a lo-fi version of something like CRJ: it optimizes for legibility over anything resembling artistic merit. And it does it well!
item.content:encoded: Chelsea Cutler belongs to what in my mind is a vanguard of interchangable, pleasant-but-never-transcendent soundcloud pop singers (EXES of course is my favorite in this group). This album is almost a lo-fi version of something like CRJ: it optimizes for legibility over anything resembling artistic merit. And it does it well!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: So
item.description:
I would probably have loved this album even more if:

  1. Sledgehammer was not on it.
  2. I had listened to it ten years ago so I could base entire swaths of my personality around it, as I have done with Graceland

It is glorious, though, and I'm probably gonna go down a Peter Gabriel rabbit hole now.
item.content:encoded:
I would probably have loved this album even more if:

  1. Sledgehammer was not on it.
  2. I had listened to it ten years ago so I could base entire swaths of my personality around it, as I have done with Graceland

It is glorious, though, and I'm probably gonna go down a Peter Gabriel rabbit hole now.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Good Guess
item.description: The instrumentals on this album are soft and nice and gorgeous and the lyrics are pleasant and introspective and I think I would love this album if the vocals weren't so cacophonous. I'll try and listen to it a few more times to see if he grows on me, but I'm skeptical.
item.content:encoded: The instrumentals on this album are soft and nice and gorgeous and the lyrics are pleasant and introspective and I think I would love this album if the vocals weren't so cacophonous. I'll try and listen to it a few more times to see if he grows on me, but I'm skeptical.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: The Price of Tea in China
item.description: Alchemist’s sensational beats (and very Madvillain-y sampling) make this fun but Boldy’s verses just do not do anything for me, in tenor or in substance.
item.content:encoded: Alchemist’s sensational beats (and very Madvillain-y sampling) make this fun but Boldy’s verses just do not do anything for me, in tenor or in substance.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Portrait in Love
item.description: I listened to this album twice and both times I forgot that I was listening to an album and not just a generic lo-fi playlist.
item.content:encoded: I listened to this album twice and both times I forgot that I was listening to an album and not just a generic lo-fi playlist.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: A Japanese Horror Film
item.description: Mumblecore Liquid Swords, and I mean that in a very positive way.
item.content:encoded: Mumblecore Liquid Swords, and I mean that in a very positive way.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Purity Ring
item.description: I mean, it’s a Purity Ring album, and a polished one at that. Macabre lyrics, sleek production, pop hooks. It is not novel for them but it is very well executed, and I like it!
item.content:encoded: I mean, it’s a Purity Ring album, and a polished one at that. Macabre lyrics, sleek production, pop hooks. It is not novel for them but it is very well executed, and I like it!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: When Man Fails You
item.description: Limerence is a work of art and a couple other tracks are standouts, but it lacks a certain level of coherence that makes me want to listen to tracks, rather than the entire album through.
item.content:encoded: Limerence is a work of art and a couple other tracks are standouts, but it lacks a certain level of coherence that makes me want to listen to tracks, rather than the entire album through.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Live at the Harlem Square Club
item.description: Joyous, joyous soul that feeds on the live crowd. I don’t think it’s possible to listen to this album without singing along to it.
item.content:encoded: Joyous, joyous soul that feeds on the live crowd. I don’t think it’s possible to listen to this album without singing along to it.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Live at Tubby's
item.description: The riffing is fun and I have to imagine that if I was there live for this set I would have dug it but man, it is a chore to listen to.
item.content:encoded: The riffing is fun and I have to imagine that if I was there live for this set I would have dug it but man, it is a chore to listen to.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Everything Will Change
item.description: This is not the best Ben-Gibbard-related live album (that is the inimitable The John Byrd EP), and it feels strictly inferior to Give Up, but as far as live albums go it is warm and pleasantly produced and I listened to it three times straight which is a pretty good sign.
item.content:encoded: This is not the best Ben-Gibbard-related live album (that is the inimitable The John Byrd EP), and it feels strictly inferior to Give Up, but as far as live albums go it is warm and pleasantly produced and I listened to it three times straight which is a pretty good sign.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Real Bad Boldy
item.description: I absolutely abhored the opening title track but it heats up from there, with Street Shit and Champion being standout entries in the back half of the album.
item.content:encoded: I absolutely abhored the opening title track but it heats up from there, with Street Shit and Champion being standout entries in the back half of the album.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Holographic Universe(s?)!
item.description: There were some fun samples in here but I can't think of a worse sign for an album than not knowing that you had finished it and moved onto the next album.
item.content:encoded: There were some fun samples in here but I can't think of a worse sign for an album than not knowing that you had finished it and moved onto the next album.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: evermore
item.description: Some pleasant, catchy bops!
item.content:encoded: Some pleasant, catchy bops!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: DJ Vision
item.description: Pretty fun, as far as forgettable electronica goes!
item.content:encoded: Pretty fun, as far as forgettable electronica goes!
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Linus and Juicy
item.description: Every year, the Jose Gonzales Trio put on a live performance of the Charlie Brown Christmas soundtrack to raise funds for the Strawshop Theatre (a troupe of which I'm a fairly ardent supporter.) It is perhaps my favorite part of Christmas, and this is a recorded version of that music. And, I mean, I love these guys but there's no improving on the original.
item.content:encoded: Every year, the Jose Gonzales Trio put on a live performance of the Charlie Brown Christmas soundtrack to raise funds for the Strawshop Theatre (a troupe of which I'm a fairly ardent supporter.) It is perhaps my favorite part of Christmas, and this is a recorded version of that music. And, I mean, I love these guys but there's no improving on the original.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: A Written Testimony
item.description: Probably not a great sign that I thought “oh, I should listen to this, I didn’t realize Jay Elec had finally dropped an official album” and then remembered halfway through that I had listened to this six months prior, and that the clue that led to my recall of this fact was a terrible Jay-Z lyric.
item.content:encoded: Probably not a great sign that I thought “oh, I should listen to this, I didn’t realize Jay Elec had finally dropped an official album” and then remembered halfway through that I had listened to this six months prior, and that the clue that led to my recall of this fact was a terrible Jay-Z lyric.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: We Will Always Love You
item.description: The Jamie XX feature and Leon Bridges alone make this a classic but wow the entire thing is just beautiful from start to finish.
item.content:encoded: The Jamie XX feature and Leon Bridges alone make this a classic but wow the entire thing is just beautiful from start to finish.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Blue Hours
item.description: Felt like a softer, folkier version of Frightened Rabbit. Will revisit once it is colder out, because this is definitely an autumnal album.
item.content:encoded: Felt like a softer, folkier version of Frightened Rabbit. Will revisit once it is colder out, because this is definitely an autumnal album.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Honestly Nevermind
item.description: I have a distinct impression that this is going to get panned, but you know what? This is the most interesting thing Drake has done in a long time, and I don't mind the simple-but-catchy dancehall beats.
item.content:encoded: I have a distinct impression that this is going to get panned, but you know what? This is the most interesting thing Drake has done in a long time, and I don't mind the simple-but-catchy dancehall beats.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Time Skiffs
item.description: This was dreamlike and nice, but I think I'm at the point where I simply cannot care about Animal Collective. I've tried for two decades and it's time to give up.
item.content:encoded: This was dreamlike and nice, but I think I'm at the point where I simply cannot care about Animal Collective. I've tried for two decades and it's time to give up.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: Call Me If You Get Lost
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)

item.title: God's Fifth Wish
item.description: I'm not one to criticize Fat Jon instrumentals (they're great!) but I literally forgot what this album was a week after listening to it.
item.content:encoded: I'm not one to criticize Fat Jon instrumentals (they're great!) but I literally forgot what this album was a week after listening to it.
item.author: me@jmduke.com (Justin Duke)
